metadata.title: CVE-2021-46909 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: ARM:footbridge: fix PCI interrupt mapping Since commit 30fdfb929e82 ("PCI: Adda call to pci_assign_irq() in pci_device_probe()"), the PCI code will callthe IRQ mapping function whenever a PCI driver is probed. If these aremarked as __init, this causes an oops if a PCI driver is loaded or boundafter the kernel has initialised.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-46909` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-147.151
linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-147.151
linux-image-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.15.0-147.151
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-147.151
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.15.0-147.151
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-5.4.0-152-generic - 5.4.0-74.83~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-152-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-74.83~18.04.1
